business.headline: Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

entertainment.headline: Agastya Nanda on working with Dharmendra in Ikkis: He was always involved Agastya Nanda shared his experience of working with late actor Dharmendra in the upcoming war-drama 'Ikkis' (2026). The actor spoke to India Today, about sharing screen-space with Dharmendra.

Is Kartik Aaryan the masked Punjabi singer Talwiinder? Fans speculate Ahead of 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri' release, fans are noting the similarity in the physical appearance of Punjabi singer Talwiinder and Kartik Aaryan. The movie will hit theatres on December 25.

Tanya Mittal's lift claim confirmed, fans clap back at haters Recent footage and multiple sources have verified Tanya Mittal's statement about having a lift in her Gwalior residence, a claim that sparked controversy during her appearance on Bigg Boss 19.

The film's strength lies in its mood and performances, offering a reflective and restrained narrative that stands apart from typical thrillers.

Farrhana Bhatt credits grandfather for raising her fierce on his death anniversary 'Bigg Boss 19' first runner-up, Farrhana Bhatt honoured her late grandfather on his death anniversary, expressing gratitude for the way he raised her to be strong and resilient.

'Ikkis' tells the story of Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal, India's youngest Param Vir Chakra recipient.

Kerala actor assault: Survivor speaks out after convict's video reveals identity The survivor of the 2017 Kerala actor assault case responded to a video shared by one of the convicts, Martin Antony, which reveals her identity and includes derogatory remarks. She called out those sharing the content, appealing to everyone to let her live.

Still grieving: Esha Deol seeks kindness in moving post after Dharmendra's death Esha Deol expressed her ongoing grief over the loss of her father, actor Dharmendra, and announced she will be returning to work after a break. She shared an emotional post in her Instagram stories.

Set in the pharmaceutical world, the show is gripping despite minor shortcomings.

general news.headline: Taiwan street horror: Smoke bomb, knife attack as man pounces on crowd, kills 3Three people were killed and five injured when a knife-wielding attacker went on a rampage in central Taipei on Friday, before then dying during a police chase after falling from a building.

Poll-bound Tamil Nadu sees 97 lakh names dropped from draft rolls after SIRThe Election Commission of India published Tamil Nadu's integrated draft electoral roll on December 19 after the Special Intensive Revision exercise, with several districts recording deletions, including Chennai, Coimbatore, Dindigul, Karur and Kanchipuram.

The warning proved eerily true as Bangladesh is now reeling from violence ahead of crucial February 2026 elections.

Osman Hadi killing: Why Dhaka media offices were attacked, set ablaze by mob?Mobs protesting anti-India leader Sharif Osman Hadi's killing ransacked and set fire to offices of Bangladeshi news outlets, Prothom Alo and The Daily Star. Dozens of journalists and staff were trapped amid smoke and fire for hours. Protesters accused the newspapers of being "Delhi's lapdog" and "Sheikh Hasina's enabler". But what's the whole truth?

Live: Sharif Osman Hadi's mortal remains reach Dhaka, funeral to be held tomorrowBangladesh Protests Live Updates: Protests erupted across Bangladesh after the death of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with thousands converging at Shahbag and accusing authorities of failing to protect him. Demonstrators chanted slogans and waved placards, many of them openly showing anti-India and anti–Sheikh Hasina sentiments. The unrest escalated into violence, with protesters vandalising the offices of Daily Prothom Alo and Daily Star. The Awami League's office in Rajshahi was also reportedly torched. Protests spread beyond the capital, with stone-pelting reported at the Indian Assistant High Commission in Chattogram. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Over 70 lakh names dropped in Gujarat from draft electoral rolls after SIREarlier, Gujarat had a total of 50,843,436 registered voters. After the publication of the draft electoral roll, the total number of voters came down to 43,470,109. This means that during the SIR campaign, 7,373,327 voters' names were removed from the draft electoral roll.

And the US is partly to blame.

She claimed that unqualified Indian applicants use fraud and bribery to enter the US, even as she urged the US to pause the visa programme pending a full audit.

Anti-India protests in Bangladesh after Osman Hadi killing has Pak-Jamaat link?Following the death of anti-India radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, Bangladeshi Islamists have taken to the streets to protest against India. Slogans condemning India and demanding Hadi's killers be brought back echoed throughout Dhaka, Rajshahi, and Chittagong. Indian diplomatic missions have also been the targets of the protests. Hadi's death has been turned into a theatre of anti-India rhetoric.

Captain Suryakumar Yadav, 35, is unlikely to continue beyond the biennial tournament, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

Yashasvi Jaiswal shares positive medical update from hospital after health scareIndia opener Yashasvi Jaiswal said he is recovering well after being hospitalised with severe stomach cramps following Mumbai's SMAT 2025 clash against Rajasthan on December 16 at the MCA Stadium in Pune.

ISL clubs told to submit consortium proposals as AIFF fails to get league underwayISL clubs have been asked to step in as Indian football remains stuck in limbo. With no season start date in sight, a proposed consortium may decide the league's immediate future.

Manchester United not the problem: Scott McTominay shuts post-exit form claimsScott McTominay has dismissed claims that players improve simply by leaving Manchester United. The midfielder insists the Old Trafford spotlight, not the system, often distorts how performances are judged.

Varun Chakravarthy welcomes pressure as he refines mindset for T20 World Cup prepIndia spinner Varun Chakravarthy highlights the importance of mental preparation, sticking to the basics, and maintaining consistency as he prepares for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Ashes 2025: Travis Head turns Adelaide into England's Ashes nightmareAshes 2025: Travis Head turned fleeting English hope into Adelaide despair yet again. His unbeaten century powered Australia into total control, leaving England staring at a third straight Ashes defeat.

Not Richa Ghosh, Harmanpreet Kaur still the best to lead India, reckons Anjum ChopraAnjum Chopra backed Harmanpreet Kaur to continue leading India across formats, citing her match-winning pedigree despite leadership succession talk, as she prepares to captain the team against Sri Lanka.

Unsold at IPL auction, Devon Conway smashes 226 vs WI in Mount MaunganuiAfter being unsold at the IPL 2026 auction, former Chennai Super Kings opener Devon Conway went on to smash his career-best Test score in the third Test against the West Indies at Mount Maunganui.

India to pick T20 World Cup 2026 squad on December 20 in MumbaiIndia is set to pick and reveal their squads for the upcoming home T20I series against New Zealand and the T20 World Cup 2026 squad on December 20 in Mumbai at the BCCI Headquarters.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
